name: table_schema_specs_for_c2m2_encoding_of_GTEx_v7_data
title: A complete list of schematic specifications for the resources (tables) that will be used to represent GTEx v7 (meta)data prior to ingest into a CFDE C2M2 database instance.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this File

fields.name: location
fields.description: A resolvable identifier pointing to the location of this File

fields.name: information_type
fields.description: A CV term ID referencing the type of data contained in this File (target ontology: EDAM)

fields.name: file_format
fields.description: A CV term ID referencing the data format in which this File is encoded (target ontology: EDAM)

fields.name: length
fields.description: The length of this File in bytes

fields.name: filename
fields.description: A suggested local filename for this File

fields.name: md5
fields.description: MD5 checksum for this File

resources.name: BioSample
resources.title: Biosample
resources.description: A tissue sample or other physical specimen

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this BioSample

fields.name: sample_type
fields.description: A CV term ID referencing the type of material represented by this BioSample (target ontology: OBI)

fields.name: anatomy
fields.description: A CV term ID locating the origin of this BioSample within the physiology of its Subject (target ontology: UBERON)

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: A foreign key referencing the experimental protocol that generated this BioSample

resources.name: Subject
resources.title: Subject
resources.description: The source organism(s) from which a BioSample is generated

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this Subject

fields.name: granularity
fields.description: A foreign key referencing the scope of this Subject: single organism; group of named organisms (e.g. host plus pathogen); environmental sample

resources.name: DataEvent
resources.title: Data Event
resources.description: An event which generates a data object, e.g.: an assay producing a BioSample; a procedure that produces one or more Files from a BioSample (e.g., sequencing); an observation producing a phenotypic datum (e.g. a BMI measurement); a procedure generating new data by processing existing Files (e.g., sequence assembly)

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this DataEvent

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: A foreign key referencing the experimental protocol (or protocol portion) associated with this DataEvent

fields.name: rank
fields.description: An integer specifying the relative sequence ordering associated with this BioSample within the set of associated BioSamples

fields.name: event_ts
fields.description: A datestamp explicitly specifying the date on which this BioSample was collected/generated

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this Dataset

fields.name: data_source
fields.description: A foreign key referencing the data-generating program or entity that produced this Dataset

fields.name: title
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this Dataset

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this Dataset

resources.name: SubjectGranularity
resources.title: Subject Granularity
resources.description: INTERNAL CV: A descriptor for the scope of a Subject (the source for a BioSample), e.g.: single organism; group of named organisms (e.g. host plus pathogen); environmental sample

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this SubjectGranularity

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this SubjectGranularity

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this SubjectGranularity

resources.name: SampleType
resources.title: Sample Type
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of terms describing types of material that can be BioSamples

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this SampleType

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this SampleType

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this SampleType

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate names) for this SampleType

resources.name: InformationType
resources.title: Information Type
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of terms describing types of data contained in File objects

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this InformationType

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this InformationType

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this InformationType

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate names) for this InformationType

resources.name: FileFormat
resources.title: File Format
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of terms describing formats in which File objects can be encoded

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this FileFormat

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this FileFormat

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this FileFormat

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate names) for this FileFormat

resources.name: Anatomy
resources.title: Anatomy
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of terms locating the origin of a BioSample within the physiology of its Subject

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this Anatomy object

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this Anatomy object

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this Anatomy object

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate names) for this Anatomy object

resources.name: Protocol
resources.title: Protocol
resources.description: INTERNAL CV: A sequence-based description of an experimental method

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this Protocol

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this Protocol

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this Protocol

resources.name: CommonFundProgram
resources.title: Common Fund Program
resources.description: INTERNAL CV: A list of data-generating programs or entities; every Dataset object must be bound to a member of this collection

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this Common Fund Program

fields.name: website
fields.description: A URL for the main website of this Common Fund Program

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this Common Fund Program

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this Common Fund Program

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this SubjectGroup

fields.name: title
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this SubjectGroup

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this SubjectGroup

resources.name: ObjectsInDatasets
resources.title: Objects in Datasets
resources.description: Association between an object (Subject, SubjectGroup, BioSample, File or Dataset) and a containing Dataset

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of a contained object

fields.name: type
fields.description: The (C2M2 table-name) type of the contained object

fields.name: contained_in
fields.description: The ID of a Dataset containing the contained object

resources.name: ProducedBy
resources.title: Produced By
resources.description: Association between an object (BioSample, File, or Dataset) and the (unique) DataEvent that produced it

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: type
fields.description: The (C2M2 table-name) type of the object

fields.name: produced_by
fields.description: The ID of the (unique) DataEvent that produced the object identified in the first column

resources.name: SubjectsInSubjectGroups
resources.title: Subjects In Subject Groups
resources.description: Association between a Subject and a containing SubjectGroup

fields.name: SubjectID
fields.description: The ID of a Subject

fields.name: SubjectGroupID
fields.description: The ID of a SubjectGroup that contains the Subject identified in the first column

resources.name: SubjectTaxonomy
resources.title: Subject Taxonomy
resources.description: Association between a Subject and a (numeric) NCBI Taxonomy Database ID describing the Subject

fields.name: SubjectID
fields.description: The ID of a Subject

fields.name: NCBITaxonID
fields.description: A CV term ID describing the taxonomy of the Subject identified in the first column (target ontology: NCBI Taxonomy Database)

resources.name: NCBI_Taxonomy_DB
resources.title: NCBI Taxonomy DB
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of terms describing taxa indexed in the NCBI Taxonomy database

fields.name: id
fields.description: The canonical ID of this taxon

fields.name: name
fields.description: Short name for this taxon

fields.name: description
fields.description: Long descriptor for this taxon

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate names) for this taxon

resources.name: AuxiliaryData
resources.title: Auxiliary Data
resources.description: DCC-specific (extension) metadata not covered by the core C2M2 model

fields.name: object_type
fields.description: A keyword representing the (C2M2 table-name) type of object with which the metadata contained in the current record is associated

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object associated with the metadata in the current record

fields.name: keyword
fields.description: A short, human-readable description of the metadata in the current record

fields.name: index
fields.description: An integer index (should default to 0 for atomic objects) meant to facilitate the optional serialization of arrays

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the metadata represented by the current record
